cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 70 miles SSE of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest, then turning north-northwest and tracking along the southwest and west coast of Florida toward the eastern Gulf and the Florida Panhandle/Georgia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Lower Florida Keys early Sunday, then second landfall near Naples–Marco Island, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Fernandina Beach to Edisto Beach
weather_observation.warning_coast: Fernandina Beach southward around the entire Florida peninsula to Indian Pass, including Tampa Bay and the Florida Keys
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida west coast from Cape Sable through Tampa Bay to the Big Bend, and adjacent Gulf waters
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds possible; sustained 74–90+ mph with higher gusts Monday morning–afternoon
weather_observation.storm_surge: Peak inundation 5–8 ft above ground possible in Tampa Bay, including Port Manatee terminals
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–15 inches with isolated totals near 20 inches, producing flash-flood potential on the port property
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, large and destructive waves in Tampa Bay, dangerous rip currents, prolonged power outages
